Reviews.Title: High hopes crashed and burned,when this item just would not work
Reviews.Author: DISenchanted
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 of these units, new in box, from Walmart.There are 4 channels, so you can have 4 cameras with one base unit.These were on clearance for $40 (regular $127)I wanted one for the front door, one for the back door, one for inside monitoring.The camera looked to be very solidly built.  It looked like it WOULD hold up to outdoor use.But things went downhill fast.The software simply would NOT work.I have 3 different computers, running 3 different versions of windows, and I could NOT get the DVR to work on any pc. (windows XP home, XP media center 2005, Vista Ultimate)The little tiny instruction sheets (about the size of 5 index cards, folded in half, to make a booklet) did NOT give insight into what windows systems were or were not compatible.  I could not find any minimum PC requirements anywhere.(I planned to use this as a DVR, to record video events on my PC)On my Vista pc, the software WOULD NOT even load.  The install would crash and abort.On XP home, the software installed BUT.... when you launched it, you would often get an exception error.I visted the WISECOMM website, but could not get any drivers nor downloads that might help me.I was never even able to get a picture to come up on my pc (from the camera to the base unit DVR).After spending a couple hours with it, I packed them up and took them back to walmart for a refund.I really had high hopes for this unit, but if it won't work, then why bother with it.

Reviews.Title: Just Terrible
Reviews.Author: Arran Lappin
Reviews.Content: It's a cheap camera, that's what you pay for and that's what you'll get. The static interference is atrocious at 15ft away I can't imagine 400. It boasts about on board mics but I cant find them, there are zero audio settings in the software or users manual. The camera itself has a pretty decent image though it's never stable. The night vision's impressive but again this means nothing with out a good connection. Forget about customer service they have yet to finish that portion of their website. So buyer beware. Your experience could be different but yo will be gambling your money.

Reviews.Title: drivers found
Reviews.Author: Robert Mosemak "Docbob"
Reviews.Content: Many people don't have the drivers for this unit. I was given this link and downloaded the DVR drivershttps://dl.dropbox.com/u/8561352/CW5700.zip

Reviews.Title: Good For the Money
Reviews.Author: Mark D "Mark D"
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit to install in my carport about three weeks ago. So far it works better than I expected for the money I paid.  The software installed without a hitch, the camera and the receiver does exactly what I had expected. The software includes unexpected bennies like camera and motion detection settings plus a recording scheduler, and frame selector for the PC. The camera construction is heavy duty too, made of metal not plastic. Next I buy another wireless camera, since the DVR is set up for four cameras.

Reviews.Title: Clover CW5700 2.4 GHz Wireless Video
Reviews.Author: CoffeeQC
Reviews.Content: Couldn't install DVR software on mini disc because my antivirus program detected a trojan,IFinst27.exe.  Visited Wisecomm website and sent emails to sales and tech addresses provdided.  Both emails were rejected.

Reviews.Title: Nice item
Reviews.Author: Garland C.
Reviews.Content: This replaced part of another one we already had. The first one we had lasted 5 years, until it was knocked of and broken.

Reviews.Title: Absolute Garbage
Reviews.Author: MWill911
Reviews.Content: This camera is a waste of money. After installing the software on my computer and setting up two of these cameras, it didn't work so I called tech support. They told me the driver only works with Windows XP and nothing else (no indication on the box or website). What year is it??

Reviews.Title: Incredible and affordable wireless security camera.
Reviews.Author: AllnPttrsn
Reviews.Content: Excellent security system. I am very pleased and very impressed with this security camera. It offers day and night recording. It has LED's, and it's wireless. You can use a USB or your computer to store the recording. It is very convenient and reliable. It's a must for indoor and outdoor surveillance of your property. Take my advice buy this device you'll be more than pleased!!

Reviews.Title: Expensive Junk
Reviews.Author: Frank J. Ayd III
Reviews.Content: Unpacked the unit today. Read the instructions.  Installed the camera and base station about 20 feet apart. No video or audio out of the base station to a known working monitor.  Moved the camera next to the base station but only received video and audio noise.  Tried to contact Wisecomm but the url on the pitiful instruction manual does not work.  Since I purchased the unit more than a year ago I guess I am SOL.  Save your money.  Don't buy Wisecomm expensive junk!

Reviews.Title: dissapointing
Reviews.Author: MC BEEFUS
Reviews.Content: No driver support past XP, the software that comes with looks like they paid an highschool intern to write this. That being said I could use a copy of the driver and setup install files if anyone has them.Any have a copy of the software? It's not on the vendors website.

Reviews.Title: Clover 2.4GHz wireless security camera
Reviews.Author: JGorman
Reviews.Content: The video quality of this camera system is fair to midland. I am having trouble finding software supprot for the security set up. the night vision quality is poorer than I thought it would be but better than a web cam.  Over all I am satisfied with the security camera.

Reviews.Title: keep looking

Anything more than that the picture flickers and loses connection.No idea how it would work with the PC because the software that came with it will not install.Nothing online to help.Returning it tomorrow.keep looking
